title: 820-4924 als issue.
message:
hi, this mac came in pristine, no damage at all anywhere, but when J4002 is plugged in, 10s after booting, mac wil shutdown immediately.
with j4002 unplugged,macbook is normal. when tested with another flex, its normal. any chance to repair this or maybe masking a few line to prevent restarT ?

title: 820-4924 als issue.
message:
Exact C4013 voltage?
Check it with original LCD assembly.

title: 820-4924 als issue.
message:
the problem is from the customer's flex.  using my known good, everything works..
but replacing the whole assembly isnt viable..
anyway maybe i can fix the flex ?

title: 820-4924 als issue.
message:
You may have problem with ALS, simply to solved; just cut off corresponding lines to J4002.
But is not normal the restart symptom in this case.
For this reason I asked you about that voltage; it may drop if there is a problem with camera, or ALS power.

title: 820-4924 als issue.
message:
ok so the problem turn out to be from logicboard, as my known good logicboard doesnt have issue in customer's assembly.
c4013 voltage is not stable, no more than 100mv.
pp5v_s0 at l4010 isnt present too, but board can turn on, whats happening.

title: 820-4924 als issue.
message:
ok so logicboard died out of nowhere.
pp5v_s5 is cycling.
pp3v3_s5 is cycling.
i have measure pp5v_s5, s4, s3, s0
pp3v3_s5, s4,s3, s0
ppvrtc, and i use thermal cam, but i dont see any short.
is this tps problem ?

title: 820-4924 als issue.
message:
"cycling" still means restarting every 10s?
Remove L4010 and check what happens (with original flex).

title: 820-4924 als issue.
message: yes, its restarting, but maybe every 3s.

title: 820-4924 als issue.
message: no I mean, the logicboard died. so we troubleshoot dead logicboard now..

title: 820-4924 als issue.
message:
Test it alone on the desk.
Check for short on any power rail.

title: 820-4924 als issue.
message:
ok so q1920 and q1420 is blown. replaced both, macbook turned on, back to square one. j4002 plugged in will cause restart in 10s after booting.
c4013 is 5v, without j4002 conected.

title: 820-4924 als issue.
message:
"Remove L4010 and check what happens (with original flex)."
???

title: 820-4924 als issue.
message:
okk..
l4010 removed, no more restart.
no ic to blame, too.
as expected, camera doesnt work too.
im quite confused about the conclusion, wheres the wrong ? 
pp5v_s0 is 5v, so pp5v3 must be good too.

title: 820-4924 als issue.
message:
So you have a problem on camera circuitry, inside LCD assembly.
Resolder L4010 and cut off traces to pins 8 & 9 of J4002.
Just for test, will probably don't help...

title: 820-4924 als issue.
message: But my own known good machine doesnt restart with that assembly, or its picky like?

title: 820-4924 als issue.
message:
Remove C4013, just in case.
Shouldn't be the problem, if machine only restarts when connect the camera cable.

If you connect the same screen assembly in other machine, do you get keyboard backlight and camera works?

title: 820-4924 als issue.
message:
Yes. my own machine ( known good ) doesnt restart with the screen assembly, 
but its okay, customer agreed to replace logicboard now..
